backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing the backend with user profiles, social media post CRUD, metrics logging, and webhook log storage, all protected by role-based access control via MixinAuthorization.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module that defines old (leads/services) and new (posts/metrics/webhookLogs) actor state types and provides a `run` function that resets state to empty maps for the new schema.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping implemented feature IDs (social scheduler, content calendar, metrics dashboard, external webhooks) to their associated frontend files, components, and test IDs with confidence ratings.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file containing one-to-two sentence summaries of all frontend source files, describing each page, component, hook, and utility module in the project.
frontend/index.css: Global CSS file importing Tailwind directives and defining CSS custom properties for the design system's color tokens in both light and dark themes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the React app titled 'Quick Bee AI Growth Engine' that mounts the app into a root div and loads the main TypeScript module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app router using TanStack Router, defining all application routes including social media routes (/social-scheduler, /content-calendar, /social-metrics, /external-webhooks, /external-tools) wrapped in a CartProvider and Layout.
frontend/src/components/AppSidebar.tsx: Renders the application sidebar with collapsible navigation links grouped into main and social media sections, including a cart item badge on the checkout link.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Defines the root layout wrapping the AppSidebar and a main content area with an Outlet for child routes and a footer.
frontend/src/components/MetricsFormModal: Modal dialog for creating or editing social media metrics entries, with fields for platform, date, and numeric engagement stats stored as BigInt.
frontend/src/components/PostFormModal.ts: Modal dialog for creating or editing social media posts, supporting fields for title, caption, platform, status, scheduled date, tags, and notes.
frontend/src/contexts/CartContext.tsx: Provides a React context for shopping cart state with add, remove, update, and clear operations, persisted to localStorage.
frontend/src/data/masterPlans.ts: Defines and exports three static master pricing plans (Spark, Surge, Titan) with features and INR prices for display in the UI.
frontend/src/data/seedServices.ts: Exports a static array of seed service definitions with packages and addons (prices as BigInt) used to pre-populate the services catalog.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor using React Query, invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and hook for Internet Identity authentication using DFINITY's AuthClient, exposing login/logout functions and status flags. Includes an `InternetIdentityProvider` component that persists identity across page reloads.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for backend data fetching and mutations, including active social media post/metrics/webhook queries and stubbed-out Lead and Service management hooks that throw errors since those backend methods no longer exist.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports Google Fonts, configures Tailwind CSS with a dark teal-themed design system, and defines reusable component classes like glass-card, teal-gradient, sidebar-link, and status badges.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app wrapped with `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider` into the root DOM element.
A page component that takes a keyword input, calls an AI API to generate SEO blog posts, social media captions, LinkedIn posts, and Instagram carousel outlines, then displays and allows copying or exporting the results.
frontend/src/pages/AISmartSystemsPage.ts: A page component offering multiple AI-powered sales tools (service recommender, proposal generator, pricing strategy, closing scripts, follow-up messages) where users fill in fields and receive AI-generated outputs via a shared `callAI` utility.
frontend/src/pages/AnalyticsEnginePage.t: Analytics Engine page that lets users select a date range, optionally POST to a configured webhook, and display mock GA4-style KPIs and charts (sessions, users, revenue, conversion rate) using Recharts.
frontend/src/pages/AutomationDashboardPa: Automation Dashboard page that displays a list of toggleable automations (WhatsApp, proposals, follow-ups, payments, onboarding) and persists their on/off state via automationConfig utilities.
frontend/src/pages/AutomationWorkflowsPa: Automation Workflows page that lists predefined workflows (lead, meeting, payment, analytics, content) and allows manually triggering each by POSTing to the configured webhook URL, with per-workflow status tracking.
frontend/src/pages/CheckoutPage.tsx: Checkout page that shows cart items with quantity controls, calculates the grand total, and initiates a Razorpay payment flow, redirecting to success or failure pages on completion.
frontend/src/pages/ContentCalendarPage.t: Content Calendar page that renders a monthly calendar grid, groups social media posts by scheduled date fetched from the backend, and supports creating or editing posts via a modal form.
frontend/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx: Main dashboard page displaying lead stats, service counts, quick action navigation links, automation status, and recent webhook logs with a hero banner.
frontend/src/pages/DataExportPage.tsx: Page for exporting app data (leads, services, configs, logs) in multiple formats (JSON, CSV, Excel, PDF) via per-category export cards with format selection dropdowns.
frontend/src/pages/ExternalToolsPage.tsx: Informational page listing external automation and social media tools (Zapier, Make, Buffer, etc.) with descriptions, use cases, and a step-by-step webhook integration guide.
Page for viewing and managing incoming external webhook logs, displaying the receiver endpoint URL and allowing users to expand, refresh, or clear log entries.
frontend/src/pages/LeadsPage.tsx: CRM leads management page supporting create, edit, delete, and export of leads with a modal form, status color coding, and grid/list view toggle.
frontend/src/pages/PaymentFailurePage.ts: Simple error page shown after a failed payment, offering buttons to retry checkout or return to the home page.
frontend/src/pages/PaymentSuccessPage.ts: Confirmation page shown after a successful payment that clears the cart, triggers a payment automation, and displays a generated invoice reference number.
frontend/src/pages/SalesConfigPage.tsx: A settings page for configuring sales integrations (API keys, WhatsApp, Razorpay, email, CRM/automation webhooks, Calendly) with per-field enable/disable toggles, connection status badges, and optional webhook test functionality.
frontend/src/pages/ServiceManagementPage: An admin CRUD page for managing services, supporting create/edit/delete/duplicate/reorder operations with a modal form that handles tiered packages and add-ons, using React Query hooks for backend interaction.
frontend/src/pages/ServicesCatalogPage.t: A customer-facing services catalog page with category filtering, a preview modal for selecting package tiers and add-ons, and cart integration; also seeds initial services from master plan data if none exist.
frontend/src/pages/SocialMetricsPage.tsx: A social media analytics page that displays KPI totals and a bar chart aggregated by platform, with filtering by platform and date range, and full CRUD for social media metrics records via a form modal.
frontend/src/pages/SocialSchedulerPage.t: A social media post scheduler page with list/grid view modes, platform and status filters, and full CRUD for posts using a form modal, displaying posts with color-coded platform and status badges.
frontend/src/pages/WebhookLogsPage.tsx: React page that displays webhook call logs in a filterable table, with options to filter by tool name or status (success/error) and clear all logs.
frontend/src/utils/aiClient.ts: Utility that sends chat messages to a configured OpenAI-compatible API endpoint using credentials from salesConfig, and logs each call via webhookLogger.
frontend/src/utils/automationConfig.ts: Defines the AutomationConfig interface with five boolean automation toggles and provides localStorage-backed get/save functions with defaults.
frontend/src/utils/automationTrigger.ts: Sends a POST webhook request to the configured automation URL when a named automation is enabled, logging the result via webhookLogger.
frontend/src/utils/downloadHelper.ts: Provides browser-side file download utilities supporting JSON, CSV, and Excel (SpreadsheetML) formats, with nested object flattening and BigInt serialization.
frontend/src/utils/mockAnalyticsData.ts: Generates randomized mock analytics data (sessions, users, revenue, traffic sources, top pages) for a given date range.
frontend/src/utils/razorpayCheckout.ts: Dynamically loads the Razorpay SDK and opens a payment checkout modal using the key from salesConfig, invoking success or failure callbacks on completion.
frontend/src/utils/salesConfig.ts: Defines the SalesConfig interface for API, payment, and webhook credentials with per-field enable toggles, and provides localStorage-backed get/save functions.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for reading URL query parameters from both standard and hash-based routes, with sessionStorage persistence and hash cleanup helpers.
frontend/src/utils/webhookLogger.ts: Logs webhook/API call entries (tool name, URL, payload summary, status) to localStorage, capped at 500 entries, with get and clear functions.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration for the frontend, extending the default theme with custom colors (teal, dark, chart, sidebar), fonts (Inter, Space Grotesk), border radii, box shadows, and background images, plus plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Tracks the project's current state (version 3), listing existing features (social scheduler, content calendar, metrics dashboard, webhook receiver, external tools) and architectural notes mandating that new social media modules must be additive and must not modify existing functionality.
